maml:description.maml:para: Adds an Azure Dev Ops Account to the configuration repository

This is the name of your account when you created it in Azure Dev Ops or Visual Studio Team Services. It can be found by looking at the URL you go to to access your projects and repositories `<AccountName>.visualstudio.com` or `dev.azure.com/<AccountName>`.
This is a name that will be easy for you to remember, you can use the name of the account if that's what works for you.

This is the name of your account when you created it in Azure Dev Ops or Visual Studio Team Services. It can be found by looking at the URL you go to to access your projects and repositories `<AccountName>.visualstudio.com` or `dev.azure.com/<AccountName>`.
This is a name that will be easy for you to remember, you can use the name of the account if that's what works for you.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Adding account to the configuration repository.

maml:description.maml:para: Adds an individual project from the account to the account object in the configuration repository
This is the friendly name for the account that you created using `Add-AzureDevOpsAccount`. This parameter supports tab compleation.

This is the name of the project as it's displayed in the projects main page by navigating to `https://<Your Account>.visualstudio.com/<Your Project Name>`. The project name will be displayed at the top of the project page. Don't add your project name using the URL encoded value, i.e. if your project name has spaces then the url will be something like `Your%20Project%20Name`. Currently this paramter does not perform a check for decoding the URL string so make sure you don't try and add a project name that looks like that.
This is the friendly name for the account that you created using `Add-AzureDevOpsAccount`. This parameter supports tab compleation.

This is the name of the project as it's displayed in the projects main page by navigating to `https://<Your Account>.visualstudio.com/<Your Project Name>`. The project name will be displayed at the top of the project page. Don't add your project name using the URL encoded value, i.e. if your project name has spaces then the url will be something like `Your%20Project%20Name`. Currently this paramter does not perform a check for decoding the URL string so make sure you don't try and add a project name that looks like that.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Adding a project to the selected account

maml:description.maml:para: Adds your PAT token to the windows credential manager and stores the tokens GUID, generated by the module, and its friendly name in the configuration repository.
This is the easy to remember name you assign to this token.
This is the user name that you use to login to azure dev ops, usualy in the form of a UPN. Example: `ExampleUser@contoso.com`.
This is the pat token given to you by Azure Dev Ops at your request in the security section of your profile.
This is the easy to remember name you assign to this token.
This is the user name that you use to login to azure dev ops, usualy in the form of a UPN. Example: `ExampleUser@contoso.com`.
This is the pat token given to you by Azure Dev Ops at your request in the security section of your profile.

maml:alert.maml:para: The actual token is stored by Windows and the module uses a GUID it generates as it's way of retrieving that credential value from the operating system.
Additionally this value, and other pat tokens are not loaded in to memory by the module until you make the first call to the Azure Dev Ops Rest API.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Adding a pat token for user ExampleUser@contoso.com

maml:description.maml:para: Marks a release step as approved for continued processing.
The ID for the current step in the release pipleine.
The reason message that will be included with the approval that is provided.
The ID for the current step in the release pipleine.
The reason message that will be included with the approval that is provided.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Approving Release 123456789 with comment

maml:description.maml:para: Marks a release step as being denied for continued processing.
The ID for the current step in the release pipleine.
The reason message that will be included with the denial that is provided.
The ID for the current step in the release pipleine.
The reason message that will be included with the denial that is provided.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Default Usage --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: Deny-AzureDevOpsReleaseStep -ApprovalId 123456789 -Reason "Continued release has been denied due to user acceptance tests failing"

dev:remarks.maml:para: Rejecting a release with explanation

maml:description.maml:para: Gets all the accounts registered in the modules configuration repository.
The friendly name for the account that you specified when you added it using the `Add-AzureDevOpsAccount` cmdlet.
The friendly name for the account that you specified when you added it using the `Add-AzureDevOpsAccount` cmdlet.

maml:alert.maml:para: If the `-FriendlyName` switch isn't provided then it gets all the accounts. If a value is provided then it returns only the account specified.

maml:description.maml:para: Gets a single build by specifying BuildId or get all builds for one or multiple build definitions by specifying the BuildDefinitionIds.
The Id number(s) for the build definition(s) you want to get all builds for.
The Id number of the specific build you want to get.
The Id number(s) for the build definition(s) you want to get all builds for.
The Id number of the specific build you want to get.

Getting all builds for definitions 123, 456, and 789
Getting build 456

maml:description.maml:para: Display a list of PAT Tokens currently stored in the configuration repository
The friendly name for the token that you specified when you added it using the `Add-AzureDevOpsPatToken` cmdlet.
The friendly name for the token that you specified when you added it using the `Add-AzureDevOpsPatToken` cmdlet.

maml:alert.maml:para: If the `-FriendlyName` switch isn't provided then it gets all the tokens. If a value is provided then it returns only the token specified.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Getting all Pat Tokens
Getting the token named "MyMainToken"

maml:description.maml:para: Gets a release from the release pipeline using a combination of DefinitionId and Id (if specified).

maml:description.maml:para: Retrieves a list of all fields in the project used in **All** work item types.
The fields name as it appears in the UI or its reference type.
The fields name as it appears in the UI or its reference type.

maml:alert.maml:para: This cmdlet is really useful for writing your own scripts that wrap arround the cmdlets in this moduel for workflow automation. It will provide you all the information you need on properly addressing fields with regards to work items in ADO.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Getting all fields

Name : Time Criticality ReferenceName : Microsoft.VSTS.Common.TimeCriticality Description : How does the business value decay over time. Higher values make the epic more time critical Type : Double Usage : WorkItem ReadOnly : False SupportedOperations : {=, <>, >, <...} IsIdentity : False IsPicklist : False IsPicklistSuggested : False Links : Url : https://dev.azure.com/Contoso/9f6950a2-1436-4a39-9199-32c1d592cec7/_apis/wit/fields/Microsoft.VSTS.Common.TimeCriticality NamespaceId : 00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000 RequiredPermissions : 0
Name : Title ReferenceName : System.Title Description : Stories affected and how Type : String Usage : WorkItem ReadOnly : False SupportedOperations : {=, <>, >, <...} IsIdentity : False IsPicklist : False IsPicklistSuggested : False Links : Url : https://dev.azure.com/Contoso/9f6950a2-1436-4a39-9199-32c1d592cec7/_apis/wit/fields/System.Title NamespaceId : 00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000 RequiredPermissions : 0
Name : Value Area ReferenceName : Microsoft.VSTS.Common.ValueArea Description : The type should be set to Business primarily to represent customer-facing issues. Work to change the architecture should be added as a User Story Type : String Usage : WorkItem ReadOnly : False SupportedOperations : {=, <>, >, <...} IsIdentity : False IsPicklist : False IsPicklistSuggested : False Links : Url : https://dev.azure.com/Contoso/9f6950a2-1436-4a39-9199-32c1d592cec7/_apis/wit/fields/Microsoft.VSTS.Common.ValueArea NamespaceId : 00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000 RequiredPermissions : 0
Getting field data for the System.Watermark field

Name : Watermark ReferenceName : System.Watermark Description : Type : Integer Usage : WorkItem ReadOnly : True SupportedOperations : {=, <>, >, <...} IsIdentity : False IsPicklist : False IsPicklistSuggested : False Links : Url : https://dev.azure.com/Contoso/9f6950a2-1436-4a39-9199-32c1d592cec7/_apis/wit/fields/System.Watermark NamespaceId : 00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000 RequiredPermissions : 0

maml:description.maml:para: If you can see this cmdlet something has gone wrong during the loading process of the module and you should probably file a bug report.

The friendly name of the Pat token that you specified when you added it to the configuration repository.

maml:description.maml:para: This cmdlet allows you set configure a default account that you want to have set as the current context when the module loads.
The friendly name of the account that you specified when it was added to the configuration repository.
The name project name you want to have loaded automatically when the module is loaded.
The friendly name of the account that you specified when it was added to the configuration repository.
The name project name you want to have loaded automatically when the module is loaded.

maml:alert.maml:para: Basically it runs `Set-AzureDevOpsAccountContext` on your behalf when the module loads with the account and project that you specify.

maml:description.maml:para: Takes a time span string as input (the amount of time spent on a task), performs some calculations, and updates the work item with new values for completed and remaining work.
A description of the work you performed. What you supply here will be added as a comment on the work item.
The Id number of the work item you want to update your remaining work value on.

This parameter accepts an array of strings that are formatted in the string representation of a time span. Where the first two numbers represent hours, followed by a colon, the second two numbers represent minutes, followed by a colon, and the last two numbers represent seconds. Making this example  `01:25:30`  represent one hour twenty five minutes and thirty seconds.
A description of the work you performed. What you supply here will be added as a comment on the work item.
The Id number of the work item you want to update your remaining work value on.

This parameter accepts an array of strings that are formatted in the string representation of a time span. Where the first two numbers represent hours, followed by a colon, the second two numbers represent minutes, followed by a colon, and the last two numbers represent seconds. Making this example  `01:25:30`  represent one hour twenty five minutes and thirty seconds.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Adding 30 minutes of compleated work to work item 123456
Updating the compleated work and remaining work fields for task 123456 to include an additional 5 hours and 48 minutes of work.
Updating the compleated work and remaining work fields for task 123456 to include an additional 5 hours and 48 minutes of work and including a comment.

maml:description.maml:para: Takes a work item as input, compares it to the work item on the server, generates, and sends a patch file to update all changed properties of the work item provided.
The Id of the workitem in the project your currently working on.
The updated version of the work item that you want to save in Azure Dev Ops
The work item in its current state in Azure Dev Ops. This must be unmodified from the version stored in Azure or the update may not go as planned
The Id of the workitem in the project your currently working on.
The updated version of the work item that you want to save in Azure Dev Ops
The work item in its current state in Azure Dev Ops. This must be unmodified from the version stored in Azure or the update may not go as planned
Using the provided query string, performs a search of work items in your project / team.
The query formated using the "Work Item Query Language" syntax
The name of the team you want your query to run under.
The query formated using the "Work Item Query Language" syntax
The name of the team you want your query to run under.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: Search-AzureDevopsWorkItems -TeamName "MyTeam" -Query "Select [System.Id], [System.Title], [System.State] From WorkItems Where [System.WorkItemType] = 'Task' AND [State] <> 'Closed' AND [State] <> 'Removed' order by [Microsoft.VSTS.Common.Priority] asc, [System.CreatedDate] desc"

dev:remarks.maml:para: Querying Azure Dev Ops for all Taks that are not closed or removed and sorting them by the priority and created date selecting the Id, Title, and State columns.
